data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Electronic Low Voltage Dimmer Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, ‚Ä¶]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, ‚Ä¶]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, ‚Ä¶]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Electronic Low Voltage Dimmer Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Electronic Low Voltage Dimmer Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Electronic Low Voltage Dimmer Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Best of the best as dimmers go. These reverse-phase dimmers are required for some LED lighting solutions, and I've noticed that they increase the longevity and reduce the flicker of LED bulbs even when reverse-phase is not required. They're expensive, so you can do the math in terms of what makes more sense to you: replacing LED bulbs more often, or buying a reverse-phase dimmer one time so that the bulbs last longer.
1#Stops buzzing from low voltage under counter lights with "electronic" transformers. If you have low voltage under the counter led lights that buzz when you dim them, this EL dimmer may solve the problem. This dimmer is design to be used with led lights that use an "electronic" transformer to step down the voltage from 120 volts to 12-24 volts. These under the counter lights are often daisy chained with snap out wires. If you use the standard box store TRIAC dimmers they will buzz. TRIAC dimmers are "leading edge chopping" dimmers that chop up the leading edge of the AC sine wave. They do not play well with electronic transformers. This is a more expensive dimmer that cuts out the trailing edge of the sine wave and is better tolerated by electronic transformers. This dimmer requires a neutral wire in your switch box unlike the TRIAC dimmer. This dimmer does not play well with old school "magnetic" transformers that use a pair of wire coils to lower the voltage. You need to confirm that your switch box has a neutral wire so I give this product three stars for ease of install. This dimmer is also much more expensive than its CL cousin so I give it three stars for value. If you just want to get rid of the hum, you should be able to remove your TRIAC dimmer and replace it with a standard on off switch.
2#Sent used/opened items. 4/5 because it worked with our halo canless recessed lights and no buzzing BUT it appeared that the items were either returned, previously opened, or returned and we paid for new items.
3#ELV dimmer are pricey but did its job. Fast shipping, worked as it should, thanks
4#Noise free dimmer! Works great with LEDs. No buzzing from this dimmer and it's easy to adjust.
5#Great at eliminating LED buzzing. Moved into a house where ceiling LED lighting fixtures constantly emitted a buzz. Having read that this is usually caused by the dimmer switches on the lighting circuits, I tried every variation available at the local Lowes and Home Depots but none of them eliminated the buzz. This one did and was worth the additional expense!
6#Right product for the job. Pricey. Does the job perfectly. Well worth the cost.
7#Stops the buzzing on Dimmable LEDs. I filled a bunch of new light fixtures with high-quality dimmable LEDs, and installed a Lutron Maestro - only to find there was a terrible buzzing/humming sound whenever the lights were turned on. After some internet research, I thought I'd give this dimmer switch (Lutron Diva ELV) a try. It worked perfectly...immediately and completely eliminated all sound. Twice the cost, but worth it.
8#Not working. open box and used 5 month after purchase, not working. broken piece
9#Expensive, but worth the elimination of ‚Äúbuzz‚Äù. Only dimmer we have used that doesn‚Äôt buzz. Even with 6 LED can lights. Impressive.
10#FINALLY a dimmer that works with low voltage LED fixtures! I‚Äôve gone through three or four different digital dimmers to control a stairway LED can light that draws a max of 9 volts at full power. Every other dimmer flickered irritatingly or did not turn off the fixture completely in the off position, since the small trickle of voltage used to operate the fancy dimmer switch was also enough to cause the fixture to glow at night. This model is not digital and it DOES require a neutral wire. You will also need sufficient depth in your wall box, this switch is as deep as standard digital dimmers, about 1 1/2‚Äù deep into the wall. Also important, if using in a 3-way (or 4-way) configuration, the dimmer MUST be installed on the load side (I.e., the outlet closest in the circuit to the light fixture, not the end that has the hot wire). Luckily, my wall box had a neutral wire. Unluckily, I would have preferred the dimmer to be on the other end of the 3-way circuit. But it turns out the location was not an issue once it was installed. I‚Äôve done (too much) research on low voltage LED dimmers, and apparently this is the only model currently on the market (early 2021) that reliably works with LED lights of all voltages. I concede that some smart dimmers will also work with low voltage LEDs, but you‚Äôll still need a neutral wire, and as for me, I didn‚Äôt need Alexa to control a side staircase light üòõ. Yes, it‚Äôs expensive. But I just sucked it up; it works where other models failed. Thanks, Lutron! Now lower your prices!
11#Didn't stop the flicker. I bought this in hopes that the flickering and random bulbs going out would stop. It was no different than my regular Diva switch, i'm returning it. I also have another one of these ELV dimmers on some under counter lights and they buzz a lot.
12#Lutron Diva 0-10v does the job it promises. We used this switch to dim our LED strip connected to Mean Well power supply with dedicated dimming line connection. Be aware, it's not a typical LED dimmer switch and is not designed to work with ordinary Home Depot Style LED lights.
13#Fixed all my buzzing. Evl is the only way I'll go from now on.I tried over 8 different dimmers.Different manufacturers,big box store dimmers.Switches would buzz,lights would buzz,service panel/breaker box would buzz and for whatever reason my stove would buzz.Sometimes the lights would be quiet and switch yet my stove upstairs would buzz and service panel.Another switch it would flip flop.These switches fixed it all.No noise,works great!!
14#Eliminate buzzing from you LED lights. This product will eliminate the buzzing when the LED lights are dimmed. This is my 3rd install of recessed lights and the 2nd time using ELV switches. They are not cheap but if your lights flicker or buzz when dimmed it is worth the investment. Lights: Halo BLD BLD6089SWHR
15#No more buzzing. Great dimmer switch. It took care of the buzzing from the switch and lights. Light are the led from Lowes
16#No buzz or hum. Installed this dimmer on four can lights works great absolutely no buzzing or hum just quite.
17#So much quieter! If you can get a neutral wire to your light switch box, then this switch will probably remedy any LED fixture buzzing you have from a standard CL dimmer. It's expensive, but if you are stuck with buzz, it might be worth the money.
18#works with dimmable LED tubes. this is the helpful ELV dimmer that does work with Toggled D-series dimmable LED tubes.
19#Does what it‚Äôs supposed to do. You need this dimmer if your LED bulbs or fixtures buzz. This summer covers most drivers
20#Commercial Electric. It's pricey but it's the only dimmer switch that worked with Commercial Electric LED Recessed Downlight with Nightlight Trim without buzzing or flickering. All of the led dimmers recommended by manufacturer were buzzing.
21#Great product. Easy to install
22#Item shipped to me was an item that was returned to Amazon as a defect. Item shipped to me was an item that was returned to Amazon as a defect. My electrician pointed this out to me and it is too late to return it. Remodeling is a pain!
23#Buzzing LED fix. Like many others, I am here because the cheaper Diva Dimmer by Lutron, which is "LED compatible", made my LED bulbs buzz like crazy. This was for a dining room fixture that hangs low and would kill the mood. So here I am spending 2.5x the cost of the first switch to get this second one but I am happy to report this fixes the humming problem! Honestly a $75 switch is insane, but cheaper than trying 6 new good looking LED bulbs. If you are in an older place, be forewarned that you need 5 wires to make this work in a 3-way (2 switch) configuration. Lucky for me there was a neutral wire jammed all the way in the back. I have no idea how the wires work, I have never installed a complicated switch like this one before, but if you read the instructions it should go easy enough. I also found it helpful to take pictures of everything before I started helping me keep the wiring straight since everyone likes to color code things differently... Took a star off for price, but the product is great.
24#Easy-to-install. Expensive dimmer but the only thing that will work on a low voltage LED light. The instructions were clear, accurate, and well illustrated. Easy-to-install for an occasional do-it-Yourselfer.
25#Actually dims LED fixtures without hum and failures. You can't get these at home depot and apparently the electricians don't know about them. After a number of very expensive LED fixtures failed (fortunately under warranty) the lighting store told me to get this type. Now the fixtures dim properly and don't hum at all. They cost more but actually work right for low power LED fixtures. All dimmers seem to clip the sine wave (PWM), but these clip the trailing side, not the leading side so the fixture does not get a high voltage surge. Instead it comes on smooth and cuts off at the end. Had to do a lot of reading to figure this out. Even the Lutron site is vague about what is going on so I may be missing some details. Works with the PIXE panels that HD used to carry. I suspect they had too many returns from use with the wrong dimmer type. Now that fixture dims properly without humming too.
26#Light integrated in Dimmer. I didn't know that this dimmer have an integrated orange light inside.
27#Zero Buzz. eliminated "buzz" on LED dimmable lights. Caveat: It requires a neutral "white" conductor, this wasnt wired to the existing 3-way toggle switch, but there was a bundle of white wires connected together in the switch box, just added the white wire from the dimmer to that bundle and it worked. Your house depending on how new it is may or may not have the white neutral wire.
28#Five Stars. worked great
29#Use ELV dimmers for LED lights! I wanted 3000K lights in my nook since I have 3500K in the kitchen next to it. Actually I'd prefer 32-3300K, but those aren't really available in A19 bulbs. Anyways, there weren't very many options at the time, so I just went with HD's 75W ecosmart bulbs in bright white. The original dimmer at that location was an incandescent Diva, so I thought the Diva C.L. was all I needed since it says it's for LED's. The dimming worked fine but there was a very noticeable buzzing (at least to me, the significant other told me I was going crazy). I thought maybe it was just the bulbs. HD recently started carrying Feit bright white bulbs so I tried those in 75W and there was still a bit of buzzing but a little less than the ecosmarts. I finally decided to try out this dimmer as a last resort, but it should have been first. The ecosmart bulbs did indeed still buzz like another reviewer said, but when I changed them to the Feits I couldn't believe my ears. I could actually hear myself think while sitting directly under the bulbs. I don't even know why the other dimmers say they're LED compatible. Do yourself a huge favor and start off with the ELV version,
30#Did not help LED buzz at all. After reading several articles as well as many Amazon reviews, I decided the steep price tag on this switch would be worth it to fix the buzz from my LED bulbs (EcoSmart 11W from HD). I had very high hopes, but unfortunately it did not help the buzz one bit. The switch and dimmer function just fine, but I do think it has somewhat of a cheap feel as has been noted in some reviews. Install was easy, but it does take up a lot of space in the box so you have to be very efficient with getting wires situated properly. The switch itself is very deep and it has 5 pre-installed wires rather than screws to attach to (all are used for a 3-way). A neutral is required so make sure you have one in the box where you are installing before you buy.
31#Eliminates LED light Buzz. I recently purchased FEIT Electric LED Retrofit lights at Costco. I love the lights and the design is superior, but I hated the buzz/ hum that I was getting from the lights with my original 15 year old dimmer switch. I didn't want to give up my lights (yet), so I ordered another new dimmer that stated it was for LED lights, the Lutron model: DVWCL-153PH-WH, White. It still buzzed, so I called FEIT Electric directly and they were so kind to send me one of their own dimmer switches for free. I installed the FEIT dimmer switch, and it was a bit better, but still buzzed. I still wasn't ready to give up the great lights, so I tried this last and most expensive switch, because I had read a post somewhere that an Electronic Low Voltage (ELV) switch almost always solved the light buzzing problems... it did! I highly recommend this switch to eliminate LED light buzz. Just keep in mind you need a Neutral wire (white in my case) in the electrical box to connect to.
32#I have purchased 100‚Äôs of items on Amazon, and ... I have purchased 100‚Äôs of items on Amazon, and this is my first review. I had to let everyone know these switches are worth ever expensive penny. I tried switch after switch to rid my undercabinet lighting of transformer hum and LED flicker, and this switch was the cure. Look no further. This will fix your LED problems!
33#Five Stars. Works well with my installed WAC Lighting SOLARAIL Kit with LED Lighting. Smooth dimmer!
34#work properly... learn your dimmers and what ... work properly...learn your dimmers and what you need to properly function before opening.
35#Nothing like what I was getting before. This dimmer solved my buzzing issues. I had tried 4 other models from he local hardware store but this is the only one that did it. Still a *tiny* buzz that can hardly be heard. Nothing like what I was getting before. I'm using EcoSmart brand in-ceiling LED can lights. The dimming is much more fine tuned and predictable compared to the cheaper CL models. No flicker at low voltage. Highly recommend. Note that you will need a neutral wire with this dimmer, so check your outlet first!.
36#Buzz kill. Eliminates buzz with LED.
37#Worth the price if dealing with LED buzzing or flickering. Expensive but worth it if you are dealing with LED noise/buzz/flickering. Installed 14 LED lights in our basement and had immediate buzzing and flickering. Reviews of the lights warned using cheaper dimmers would cause this. Tried two 150w $30/each dimmers which helped but still had some buzzing. This Lutron 300w dimmer did the trick. No buzz or flicker. It is a little deeper and wider than most others so if you have a shallow wall box or have a lot of wires inside the box it may be a little tough to fit this dimmer all the way in. I had to trim all excess wire lengths to give enough depth for this switch. A deeper box would also have worked fine.
38#Dimmers to be used with low voltage fixtures. I used these dimmers specifically for 12V DC 6" Dia PR15s from LED Waves when connected on a three-way (two switches). They work perfectly and have a good range of dimming and no flickering
39#Beautiful and functional. These are beautiful and functional; they work well with the electronic low voltage lights I am replacing at my home. I love the matching cover plates Lutron have for these dimmers.
40#My first high-voltage DIY. Great dimmer and just the solution for the buzzing sound we were getting with our new Hyperikon LED lights. These dimmers do require that your house be wired with a white neutral cable. I opened up the wall panel before ordering to make sure we had the white wires. Everything worked out fine, except that I did get two of my blacks crossed on the dimmer's red and yellow cables. I did read that if you cross them, your lights might flicker. As it turns out, the lights weren't flickering but the dimmer's amber night light was. The other dimmer was fine, so on a hunch I switched the blacks and the flickering stopped. Nice product and decent instructions (they made sense to someone with zero electrical experience).
41#Great dimmer for aspect LED ultra low profile recessed lights. This dims very well with my aspect LED ultra low profile lights in my attic nursery. I tried other ELV dimmers for LED lights, and they all still flickered when dimmed. This was super expensive for a dimmer, but in the end i guess its worth it!
42#EXPENSIVE AND LESS THAN IMPRESSED WITH PERFORMANCE. Very expensive compared to other dimmers, and with lots of mixed-message information on the site about this type of dimmer. It does not completely, silently dim LED fixtures, except at the lowest setting, hums at all other settings. Go to Lutron's site, and it's very difficult to determine from the information present whether or not this device is correct for LEDs -- if not, what the hell should one use to silently dim LED fixtures? I'm basically OK with it, but at the price paid, it should work PERFECTLY.
43#Five Stars. Awesome. No hum.
44#Low Voltage Dimmer comment-CALL Lutron before buying + they will ensure it is for your installation. Works exactly as needed to dim my fixtures. 08-07-2023 Updated comments: I have used Lutron dimmers for 50 years, most recently, LED dimming needs as the technology has evolved. I've received several e-mail queries from other Amazon members regarding if this dimmer will work with their light fixture and/or LED bulb. I highly recommend that if you're wondering if this dimmer (or any other Lutron dimmer) will work for your lighting project, that you call Lutron customer service before buying. They are very helpful, and will ask you what dimmer model you're buying, what light fixture you're installing, what LED/incandescent/flourescent light bulb manufacturer and product number you're thinking of using, whether it's line or low voltage installation, and then they'll tell you if it will work. If they think you should use a different dimmer model or light bulb, they will tell you the exact model number of Lutron dimmer you need to purchase to ensure 100% compatibility. Leviton also has a similar customer service department (or did when I was actively installing dimmers). One other suggestion I strongly suggest you follow when installing low-voltage rated dimmers: TURN OFF THE CIRCUIT BREAKER that controls the line voltage feed to the wall switch/junction box you're installing the switch. Unfortunately, it's very easy to burn out the dimmer while installing it if all power feed to it isn't turned off first. While prices have come down over the years for these low-voltage rated dimmers, they're still quite expensive compared to the ordinary ones you're used to using around your house. Thanks for reading, and I hope my updated comments help you.
45#Totally eliminated AC line noise causing buzz in my induction and audio system. Outstanding‚Äîhad terrible differential mode noise on my AC line coming from the Lutron CL dimmers. They cause pans on my induction burner to buzz, and also caused the transformer in my audio amp to buzz. Buzz changed with the amount of LED dimming. Tried everything‚Äîresistive dimmers for incandescent lights, halogens, different LED bulbs, switched the circuit's phase on the electrical panel, isolation transformers, linear noise filters, RFI/EMI filter: NOTHING WORKED....expect this ELV dimmer by Lutron. Since installing this dimmer, the buzzing is now totally gone.
46#Expensive But Eliminates Buzz in LED Recessed Lighting. While more expensive than most dimmer switches, this one really solved my "buzzing" recessed LED light problem.
47#Amazon sent us a broken switch (working like a momentary switch) and we had to order a ... It almost fixed the buzzing issue we had for the cheaper LED dimmer. This isn't a momentary switch. Has to be flipped. Amazon sent us a broken switch (working like a momentary switch) and we had to order a replacement. Still happy with it because we spent so much time figuring out why the light buzzes.
48#Five Stars. Solved buzzing LED flood light bulbs and audio speaker humming.
49#Five Stars. Great dimmer for use with low voltage LEDs
